section.p: You can update an existing trigger definition as follows using the operator Web client:

ol.li: From the operation list, select updatetriggerdefinition and click select.
In the orgid field, enter the ID of the organization for which the trigger is to be configured.

In the key field, enter the unique key of the trigger definition to be updated. The trigger definition key is generated automatically when the trigger definition is created. You can retrieve the keys of all trigger definitions for an organization by executing the retrievetriggerdefinitions function.

In the type field, enter the trigger type. Allowed values are:
ADD_SUPPLIER_TO_TECHNOLOGY_PROVIDER
MODIFY_SUBSCRIPTION
UPGRADE_SUBSCRIPTION
DEACTIVATE_SERVICE
ADD_REVOKE_USER
SUBSCRIBE_TO_SERVICE
ACTIVATE_SERVICE
REGISTER_CUSTOMER_FOR_SUPPLIER
REMOVE_SUPPLIER_FROM_TECHNOLOGY_PROVIDER
UNSUBSCRIBE_FROM_SERVICE
SAVE_PAYMENT_CONFIGURATION
START_BILLING_RUN
In the targettype field, enter WEB_SERVICE. Currently, this is the only type of target supported by .
In the target field, enter the URL of the notification service WSDL file provided by the organization that requested trigger configuration.
In the suspendprocess field, specify whether the execution of an action is to be suspended by entering either true or false. If you leave this field empty, false is the default.

conbody.section:
The syntax of the respective CLT command is as follows:
java -jar oscm-operatorsvc-client.jar <userkey> <password> updatetriggerdefinition orgid=<organizationID> type=<type> targettype=WEB_SERVICE target=<wsdlURL> suspendprocess=[true|false]
